comments.body: Per `http://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/declaration-files/do-s-and-don-ts.html` you should use Optional Parameters in this scenario. Please provide feedback.

Are you reffering to `Ftp.raw()` type signatures? If so, then my reasoning is:
* the `callback` parameter, which is last, isn't optional
* `jsftp` library defines `Ftp.raw()` (https://github.com/sergi/jsftp#ftprawcommand-args-callback) as a variadic function `Ftp.raw(command, [...args], callback)`, where `args` are proxied to the FTP call with given `command`
* per SO post: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/48854207/explicit-last-function-parameter-in-typescript this might not be possible to be done in Typescript (if it is, could you please provide me with an example?)

Thanks for your feedback!

@xyleen You're absolutely correct. After researching the `raw` command, which runs the `runCmd` function, it indeed 'automatically' picks up the last argument as the call back. It's a shame that the Rest Parameter can only be used at the end, that would make this look a lot cleaner. Thanks for your great feedback, I'll move this along.

It seems like the library not using `export default`, so this .d.ts file should not either.

Instead, you should follow the appropriate template from [the TypeScript handbook](http://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/declaration-files/templates.html).
